titleInfo.title: Photomontage of the Cheek-Neal Coffee Company and leaders of the Travelers' Protective Association at Cummins Station, two movie stills, and an ad. Nashville Tennessean, 1929 April 21.

mods.abstract: Photomontage of the Cheek-Neal Coffee Company and leaders of the Travelers' Protective Association at Cummins Station in Nashville, two movie stills of Uncle Tom's Cabin, and an ad promoting a screening of the film at the Knickerbocker Theater. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.

originInfo.publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Record has been transformed into MODS 3.5 from a Qualified Dublin Core record by the Digital Library of Tennessee, a service hub of the Digital Public Library of America, using a stylesheet available at https://github.com/digitallibraryoftennessee/DLTN_XSLT. Metadata originally created in a locally modified version of Qualified Dublin Core using ContentDM (data dictionary available: https://wiki.lib.utk.edu/display/DPLA).
